title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Part(i)

1 point is earned: For indicating that the mechanical energy of the car-Earth system is constant between point A and the highest point in the car’s trajectory

1 point is earned: For indicating that the car is still moving at its highest point and has some kinetic energy so the car-Earth system must have less gravitational potential energy, therefore must be at a lower height than it was at point A

Part(ii)

1 point is earned: For indicating that the velocity of the car at its highest point is equal to the horizontal speed at point B

1 point is earned: For stating that the speed at the highest point is cos vB cosθ

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned: For implicitly or explicitly applying conservation of energy

1 point is earned: For implicitly or explicitly indicating that the gravitational potential energy is the same at the beginning and at the end

1 point is earned: For indicating that the speed is the same at the beginning and at the end, so vA = vB cos θ, or consistent with the answer in part (a-ii)
